definition: to send off (player for a foul)/to knock out (i.e. to beat in a knock-out tournament)/to eliminate/to call out/to kill off/to pull out of (a competition)/to retire (a runner in baseball)/out (i.e. man out in baseball)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
office/situation/classifier for games: match, set, round etc

sentences.english: Carter was doubled up at first.
sentences.chinese: 卡特在一垒被连杀出局。

sentences.english: I struck out three times during the game.
sentences.chinese: 我在比赛中被三振出局。

sentences.english: He also decides when runners are safe or out at the bases.
sentences.chinese: 同时他还判定跑垒员是安全还是出局。

sentences.english: Four years ago, he suffered an ignominious first-round exit.
sentences.chinese: 四年前，他遭受了首轮出局的耻辱。

sentences.english: First paragraphs can often be struck out.
sentences.chinese: 第一段落经常会被三振出局。

sentences.english: The batsman was caught out in the first rum.
sentences.chinese: 击球手在第一局中就因击出的球被悬空截住而出局。

sentences.english: Depending upon heroics to get your product out the door is simply bad program management.
sentences.chinese: 让装腔作势使你的产品出局是最糟糕的项目管理。

sentences.english: The first two batsmen were bowled out.
sentences.chinese: 头两名击球员被判出局了。

sentences.english: China does not qualify, so it will lose out.
sentences.chinese: 中国不符合该要求，所以将要出局。

sentences.english: Uzbekistan has reached the last eight of the Asian Cup for the third time, while China was eliminated.
sentences.chinese: 至此，乌兹别克三进八强，而中国队遭小组出局。

sentences.english: He broke the habit of a lifetime yesterday when he congratulated them for thrashing Real Madrid but quickly reverted to type.
sentences.chinese: 昨天他破了一会例，赞扬他们将皇马横扫出局。

sentences.english: Bill James' belief that outs are too valuable to bunt away.
sentences.chinese: 信出局数太有价值了，不能牺牲触击掉。

sentences.english: He was out trying to turn a ball to leg.
sentences.chinese: 他想把球回击到击球员左后方场地，结果出局了。

sentences.english: So I don't think one can count him out.
sentences.chinese: 因此我认为他不会被踢出局。

sentences.english: One day he struck out three times in one game.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，他在一场比赛中三次被三振出局。

sentences.english: If your boyfriend’s team gets beaten, remember you have to be extra-nice.
sentences.chinese: 如果你男朋友支持的球队出局，记得多关心他一些。

definition: to wash out/elimination (by selection)/natural selection/to knock out (in a competition)/to die out/to phase out
to enter the venue/to enter the arena/(aviation) to approach the airfield/(investing) to get into the market
to immobilize with a lasso/to be trapped in the stock market
to agree to pay compensation/to accept liability
to take an inventory of stock/to clear out one's stock
(sports) to go out of bounds/to go over the line/to qualify for the next round of competition/(Tw) (fig.) to make the grade/to achieve success
